description: Students study the history, philosophies, and consequences of the largest nonviolent social
change campaign in U.S. history.  After several days in the Twin Cities, students embark on a
two-week field study in the South, visiting historical sites and museums, and interviewing
participants in the movement.  Past stops have included Georgia, Alabama, Mississippi, and
Tennessee.  A final week of integrative seminars in the Twin Cities allows students to consider
lessons from the freedom movement that shed light on current challenges to democracy within
